actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-112, by Ms. Slaughter (NY).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2622. The resolution waives all points of order against the following provisions in the bill for failure to comply with th provisions of clause 2 of rule XXI: beginning on page 8, line 1 through 10, line 3; beginning on page 11, lines 1 through 10; and beginning on page 27, lines 11 through 16. It shall be in order to consider the amendment printed in the report accompanying this resolution, and all points of order against said amendment for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 of rule XXI shall be waived. Debate on said amendment and all amendments thereto shall not exceed one hour.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 29.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 162 (Roll no. 157).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 253 - 163 (Roll no. 158).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2622) making appropriations for the Treasury Department, the United States Postal Service, the Executive Office of the President, and certain Independent Agencies, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2622 (appropriations).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2622) making appropriations for the Treasury Department, the United States Postal Service, the Executive Office of the President, and certain Independent Agencies, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
